vocabulary.english: drop by to visit the site
vocabulary.example: Hey, the office mentioned you'd drop by to visit the site again today.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 嗨，办公室那边说你今天要再来工地一趟
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hey, the office mentioned you'd drop by to visit the site again today. I bet you'll be pleased with the progress.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 嗨，办公室那边说你今天要再来工地一趟。我相信你会对进度满意的。

vocabulary.example: That was quick! Since the material delivery was delayed, I thought it would take longer.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 速度真快因为材料送过来的时间延期了，我本来还以为需要更长的时间呢

vocabulary.example: I recently migrated to Australia and opened an account with your bank.

vocabulary.originalSentence: No stress at all! When you're new to something, every question matters. We're here to help you sort things out. So, what's been on your mind?

vocabulary.example: I'm always confused about when bills are due, and when I get busy, I completely forget to pay them.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我老是搞不清楚账单什么时候该付
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm always confused about when bills are due, and when I get busy, I completely forget to pay them. Keeping up with bill payments is so hard. This has been bothering me for quite a while.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我老是搞不清楚账单什么时候该付。一忙起来，就忘了缴款。跟上各种账单的缴费实在是太难了。这问题困扰我好一阵子了。

vocabulary.example: Why not set up automatic payment?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您不妨开通自动扣款
vocabulary.originalSentence: Why not set up automatic payment? Just authorize direct debit. Then the bills get paid on time without you lifting a finger.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您不妨开通自动扣款？您只需要授权，然后账单会按时支付，完全不用您操心。

vocabulary.example: Direct debit? Sounds good.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 自动扣款听上去不错这个功能可以在我的手机银行应用里自己操作吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: Direct debit? Sounds good. Can I do this myself on my mobile banking app? Or do you need to activate it for me?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 自动扣款？听上去不错。这个功能可以在我的手机银行应用里自己操作吗？还是需要您帮我激活？

vocabulary.example: Actually, you'll need to give your payment details to the company billing you.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 实际上，您需要把付款信息提供给给您发账单的公司
vocabulary.originalSentence: Actually, you'll need to give your payment details to the company billing you. They're the ones who manage your payment collection. I can't set that up from our end.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 实际上，您需要把付款信息提供给给您发账单的公司。他们负责收款。我在我们银行端操作不了这个。

vocabulary.example: Got it! Knowing this method would make banking way easier.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 知道这个方法后，办银行业务会顺手很多呀
vocabulary.originalSentence: Got it! Knowing this method would make banking way easier. I'm getting used to online payments now. I'm getting more comfortable with mobile payments!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 知道这个方法后，办银行业务会顺手很多呀。我开始习惯网上支付了。用手机付款我也越来越得心应手啦。

vocabulary.example: Our mobile app actually has multiple payment methods built in.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们的手机应用其实内置了好几种付款方式
vocabulary.originalSentence: Our mobile app actually has multiple payment methods built in. You'll find it super convenient to handle everything on your own, such as managing all your bill payments.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我们的手机应用其实内置了好几种付款方式。您完全可以自己轻松搞定所有支付操作，比如管理所有账单的支付。

vocabulary.example: Mobile banking is convenient, but occasionally I still miss chatting face-to-face with a bank teller in a branch.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 手机银行是挺方便，可我偶尔还是怀念去分行找柜员面对面聊的感觉
vocabulary.originalSentence: Mobile banking is convenient, but occasionally I still miss chatting face-to-face with a bank teller in a branch. Back when I first arrived and everything felt unfamiliar, that feeling was especially strong.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 手机银行是挺方便，可我偶尔还是怀念去分行找柜员面对面聊的感觉。刚来这里啥都不熟悉那会儿，这种感觉特别强烈。

vocabulary.example: Totally get that! Just know our hotline's always open!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 完全理解记住我们热线随时畅通
vocabulary.originalSentence: Totally get that! Just know our hotline's always open! Any confusion, give us a ring right away. We've got staff ready twenty-four seven to answer any banking questions.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 完全理解！记住我们热线随时畅通！有任何不清楚马上给我们打电话。我们全天候都有工作人员，帮您解答任何银行业务问题。

vocabulary.example: Thanks a ton for your help!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 真的太感谢您的帮助了
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thanks a ton for your help! You've made everything so much easier. If anything comes up later, I'll contact you first. Seriously, I really appreciate your patience today!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 真的太感谢您的帮助了！您让一切变得简单多了。后续，要是遇到问题，我肯定第一时间联系您。说真的，今天您的耐心让我特别感激！

vocabulary.example: Hey there, come on in!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好，快请进我听说你在打听志愿者机会
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hey there, come on in! I heard you were asking about volunteering opportunities. We'd love to tell you more about how you can get involved.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好，快请进！我听说你在打听志愿者机会。我们很乐意多给你讲讲怎么参与。

vocabulary.example: Yep, I just moved here about a month ago.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 对的，我刚搬来一个月左右
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yep, I just moved here about a month ago. Trying to find things to do to get to know the area sooner. After all, it's a new place and it's nice to meet more neighbors.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 对的，我刚搬来一个月左右。想找点事儿做，好尽快熟悉这一片儿。毕竟新地方嘛，多认识点邻居挺好的。

vocabulary.example: We're always looking for people to help out with our activities.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们一直在找人给活动帮忙
vocabulary.originalSentence: We're always looking for people to help out with our activities. Honestly, volunteers help everything we do here. We really couldn't manage without them!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我们一直在找人给活动帮忙。说真的，我们所有工作都有志愿者帮忙。没有他们真忙不过来。

vocabulary.example: I work from home, so my schedule's pretty flexible.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我在家办公，所以时间安排挺自由的
vocabulary.originalSentence: I work from home, so my schedule's pretty flexible. I can spare a few hours every week to volunteer. Honestly, I mainly want to meet more new people.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我在家办公，所以时间安排挺自由的。每周都能抽出几个小时帮忙。说实话，我主要想多认识些人。

vocabulary.example: Absolutely! Lots of our volunteers end up becoming friends.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 当然很多志愿者最后都成了朋友
vocabulary.originalSentence: Absolutely! Lots of our volunteers end up becoming friends. Is there anything specific you enjoy doing? We'll try to match you with a project that suits your hobbies.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 当然！很多志愿者最后都成了朋友。你有什么特别喜欢做的吗？我们会尽量按你的兴趣匹配项目。

vocabulary.example: I'm open to anything, but I'm indeed into gardening and planting stuff.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我什么都愿意试试，不过我确实特别喜欢园艺，还有种植
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm open to anything, but I'm indeed into gardening and planting stuff. I've been working on a little veggie garden at home lately.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我什么都愿意试试，不过我确实特别喜欢园艺，还有种植。最近，我还在家搞了个小菜园呢。

vocabulary.example: I've been working on a little veggie garden at home lately.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 最近，我还在家搞了个小菜园呢
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm open to anything, but I'm indeed into gardening and planting stuff. I've been working on a little veggie garden at home lately.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我什么都愿意试试，不过我确实特别喜欢园艺，还有种植。最近，我还在家搞了个小菜园呢。

vocabulary.example: That's perfect! We actually have an ideal project.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 真好实际上我们有个项目很合适
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's perfect! We actually have an ideal project. We're fixing up that park next to the mall. Your skills would be a great fit there.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 真好！实际上我们有个项目很合适。我们在修缮商场旁边那个公园。你的特长在那儿完全能用上。

vocabulary.example: I had no idea there was a park there – I always thought it was just an empty lot.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我都不知道那儿有个公园呢，一直以为就是块空地
vocabulary.originalSentence: I had no idea there was a park there – I always thought it was just an empty lot. That's really nice to hear!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我都不知道那儿有个公园呢，一直以为就是块空地。这消息还挺让人惊喜的！

vocabulary.example: Right now, we need helpers to look after the seedlings in our shed before planting them in the park.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 现在，我们需要帮手在我们的棚子里照看那些树苗，之后再把它们种到公园里
vocabulary.originalSentence: Right now, we need helpers to look after the seedlings in our shed before planting them in the park. When they're strong enough, they'll be moved to the park.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 现在，我们需要帮手在我们的棚子里照看那些树苗，之后再把它们种到公园里。等它们长得足够结实了，就挪到公园里去。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: Right now, we need helpers to look after the seedlings in our shed before planting them in the park. | When they're strong enough, they'll be moved to the park.

vocabulary.example: I can totally do this!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这事儿我能行种本地植物，我特别乐意帮忙
vocabulary.originalSentence: I can totally do this! Planting native plants—I'd be really happy to help. And I can tell this park will look so nice once it's fixed up.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这事儿我能行！种本地植物，我特别乐意帮忙。而且我能看出这个公园修缮后一定会很漂亮。

vocabulary.example: It's a big project for sure, but it'll be worth it when we see the results.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 工程肯定不小，但看到成果就值了
vocabulary.originalSentence: It's a big project for sure, but it'll be worth it when we see the results. We'll also be installing some benches so people can relax there.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 工程肯定不小，但看到成果就值了。我们还会装些长椅，方便大家休息。

vocabulary.example: Parks are quite important to people in our community.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 公园对咱们社区居民可重要了
vocabulary.originalSentence: Parks are quite important to people in our community. Everyone needs a spot to take walks or just sit and get some fresh air.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 公园对咱们社区居民可重要了。大伙儿总得有个地方散步，或者单纯坐着透透气吧。

vocabulary.example: Definitely! We got really lucky to have raised lots of community donations to restore the park.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 没错这次公园改造能筹到很多社区捐款，真是太幸运了
vocabulary.originalSentence: Definitely! We got really lucky to have raised lots of community donations to restore the park. The whole neighborhood's keen to see it open again.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 没错！这次公园改造能筹到很多社区捐款，真是太幸运了。整个社区都盼着看到它重新开放呢。

vocabulary.example: Being able to help rebuild the park makes me really happy.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 能帮着重建公园，我特别开心
vocabulary.originalSentence: Being able to help rebuild the park makes me really happy. I feel this project is really meaningful — it gives everyone a sense of accomplishment.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 能帮着重建公园，我特别开心。感觉这个项目特别有意义，让每个人都很有成就感。

vocabulary.example: Hi! Thank you for calling our bank.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您好感谢致电我们银行
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi! Thank you for calling our bank. My name is Dylan from Customer Support. Please be aware that this call may be recorded for quality and training purposes.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您好！感谢致电我们银行。我是客户支持的迪伦。请注意，为保证服务质量和培训目的，您的通话可能会被录音。

vocabulary.example: Good morning. I just received a bill saying I owe a "late payment fee".
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 早上好我刚收到一张账单，上面说我欠了"滞纳金"
vocabulary.originalSentence: Good morning. I just received a bill saying I owe a "late payment fee". I'm sure I paid it! What's exactly going on?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 早上好。我刚收到一张账单，上面说我欠了"滞纳金"。我明明记得付过钱了！这到底是怎么回事？
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: Good morning. I just received a bill saying I owe a "late payment fee". | I'm sure I paid it! What's exactly going on?
vocabulary.chineseDelimiterVersion: 早上好我刚收到一张账单，上面说我欠了"滞纳金" | 我明明记得付过钱了这到底是怎么回事

vocabulary.example: I understand that can be frustrating.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我理解这很令人沮丧让我查一下您对该收款方的账户记录
vocabulary.originalSentence: I understand that can be frustrating. Let me check your account history for that biller. To help me, could you tell me how you made the payment?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我理解这很令人沮丧。让我查一下您对该收款方的账户记录。方便告诉我您是怎么付款的吗？

vocabulary.example: I paid it using your bank's app.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我是用你们手机银行的应用付的
vocabulary.originalSentence: I paid it using your bank's app. I really miss being able to just go into a branch and talk to a clerk face-to-face. Then I could just show them what's on my phone.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我是用你们手机银行的应用付的。真怀念能去银行分行当面跟柜员聊聊啊，这样我直接拿手机给柜员看就行了。

vocabulary.example: Don't worry. Looking at the dates, it seems you paid on the due date.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 别担心看日期，您好像是在到期日当天付的款
vocabulary.originalSentence: Don't worry. Looking at the dates, it seems you paid on the due date. For some billers, the payment might not be processed until the next business day.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 别担心。看日期，您好像是在到期日当天付的款。对一些收款方来说，款项可能要到下一个工作日才处理。

vocabulary.example: I paid on the day. It was just that the processing was late, and the biller didn't receive it before the deadline.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我当天付了钱，只是处理晚了，收款方没在截止时间前收到
vocabulary.originalSentence: I paid on the day. It was just that the processing was late, and the biller didn't receive it before the deadline. Now I have to pay that late fee? That seems unfair!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我当天付了钱，只是处理晚了，收款方没在截止时间前收到。现在我就得付那个滞纳金？这太不合理了！

vocabulary.example: Unfortunately, that's correct according to the biller's terms.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 很遗憾，根据收款方的条款，确实如此
vocabulary.originalSentence: Unfortunately, that's correct according to the biller's terms. To avoid this in the future, I strongly recommend setting up a direct debit.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 很遗憾，根据收款方的条款，确实如此。为了避免将来再发生这种情况，我强烈建议您设置直接扣款。

vocabulary.example: Direct debit? Meaning the money is taken out of my account automatically?

vocabulary.originalSentence: Direct debit? Meaning the money is taken out of my account automatically? Is that safe? What if the amount is wrong?

vocabulary.example: With direct debit, you authorise the biller to take the payment directly from your account.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 使用直接扣款，您授权收款方直接从您的账户扣款
vocabulary.originalSentence: With direct debit, you authorise the biller to take the payment directly from your account. It's very secure and ensures you never miss a payment.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 使用直接扣款，您授权收款方直接从您的账户扣款。这非常安全，确保您永远不会错过付款。

vocabulary.example: That sounds good. What about those bills that can't be set up for direct debit?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 听起来不错那不能设置直接扣款的账单呢
vocabulary.originalSentence: That sounds good. What about those bills that can't be set up for direct debit? Like my internet bill, I don't think it lets me set that up. Do I have other options?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 听起来不错。那不能设置直接扣款的账单呢？比如，我的网费账单好像就不行。我还有其他选择吗？

vocabulary.example: It was a relief when you arrived after the previous doctor decided to move back to the city. We were worried about being without a doctor for too long.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们之前还担心会很久没有医生呢
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hello! Good to see you. It was a relief when you arrived after the previous doctor decided to move back to the city. We were worried about being without a doctor for too long.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好！很高兴见到你。之前的医生决定搬回城里后，你能来真让我们松了口气。我们之前还担心会很久没有医生呢。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: Hello! Good to see you. | It was a relief when you arrived after the previous doctor decided to move back to the city. We were worried about being without a doctor for too long.

vocabulary.example: Thank you! I'm very happy to have the opportunity to take over this clinic and serve everyone.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢我很高兴能有机会接手这个诊所，为大家服务
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thank you! I'm very happy to have the opportunity to take over this clinic and serve everyone. Although life in this small town is quite different from what I was used to before.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 谢谢！我很高兴能有机会接手这个诊所，为大家服务。虽然说，小镇的生活和我以前习惯的生活很不一样。

vocabulary.example: We are really grateful that you came.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们真的很感激你能来
vocabulary.originalSentence: We are really grateful that you came. Having a doctor right here who knows us makes all the difference, especially for the little check-ups and advice.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我们真的很感激你能来。身边有个了解我们的医生太重要了，特别是日常检查和小毛病咨询。

vocabulary.example: Over the past six months or so, I've been working hard to get to know each patient and their health situation.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这半年多来，我也在努力熟悉每一位病人和他们的健康情况
vocabulary.originalSentence: Over the past six months or so, I've been working hard to get to know each patient and their health situation. This kind of close connection is hard to establish in big city hospitals.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这半年多来，我也在努力熟悉每一位病人和他们的健康情况。这种紧密的联系，在大城市的医院里，是很难建立的。

vocabulary.originalSentence: Overall, I really like the peacefulness and friendliness here. However, for some small daily habits, like certain food and drinks, the choices here are much more limited.

vocabulary.example: That's where my little shop comes in!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这就是我的小店发挥作用的地方了
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's where my little shop comes in! If there's something specific you need regularly that we don't stock, just tell me. I can usually get them through my suppliers.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这就是我的小店发挥作用的地方了！如果有什么你常用的，但我们店里没有的东西，直接告诉我一声。我通常能通过供应商拿到货。

vocabulary.example: Great! When we first moved here, we bought a few jars of jasmine tea and a few bottles of chili sauce.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 太好了，我们刚搬来时，买了几罐茉莉花茶和几瓶辣椒酱
vocabulary.originalSentence: Great! When we first moved here, we bought a few jars of jasmine tea and a few bottles of chili sauce. But now, after almost half a year, they're almost gone.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了，我们刚搬来时，买了几罐茉莉花茶和几瓶辣椒酱。但是现在，快半年了，都快见底了。

vocabulary.example: I heard from your receptionist that you have a really nice porcelain tea set at the doctor's clinic.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我从你前台那里听说，你在诊所有套很漂亮的瓷器茶具
vocabulary.originalSentence: I heard from your receptionist that you have a really nice porcelain tea set at the doctor's clinic. You must be really missing your favourite tea and that spicy kick!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我从你前台那里听说，你在诊所有套很漂亮的瓷器茶具。你肯定很想念你最喜欢的茶和那种辣味的刺激感吧！

vocabulary.example: Yes., Exactly. Without tea to refresh my mind and chili sauce to stimulate my appetite for meals.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是的啊
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yes, exactly. Without tea to refresh my mind and chili sauce to stimulate my appetite for meals, I feel like I can't get my day's work done properly.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是的啊。没有茶提神醒脑，也没有辣酱开胃下饭，我感觉我一天的工作都没法干利索。

vocabulary.example: Consider it done. That lovely tea set deserves the perfect brew.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 包在我身上那么漂亮的茶具就该配上好茶
vocabulary.originalSentence: Consider it done. That lovely tea set deserves the perfect brew. I'll put in an order for your preferred jasmine tea and chili sauce first thing tomorrow.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 包在我身上。那么漂亮的茶具就该配上好茶。我明天一早就给你订你喜欢的茉莉花茶和辣椒酱。

vocabulary.example: You're so thoughtful!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你真是太贴心了小镇的人也都很好
vocabulary.originalSentence: You're so thoughtful! The people in town are really wonderful too! Just the night before last, there was a small issue at the clinic, and several neighbors came over immediately to help. It really touched me.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你真是太贴心了！小镇的人也都很好！前天晚上，诊所有个小状况，镇上几位邻居马上就来帮忙了，让我特别感动。

vocabulary.example: That's just how we do things around here.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们这儿的人就是这样
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's just how we do things around here. Folks look out for each other, especially for someone like you who's become so important to us all.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我们这儿的人就是这样。大家互相照应，特别是对你这样对我们所有人都很重要的人。

vocabulary.example: Thank you! It's these little things that make me feel this place isn't just a workplace.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢你
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thank you! It's these little things that make me feel this place isn't just a workplace, but more like a home where I can stay for good.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 谢谢你！就是这些点点滴滴的小事，让我觉得这里不只是一个工作的地方，更像一个可以扎根的家。

vocabulary.example: You've reached the police non-emergency line.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您已拨通警察非紧急热线
vocabulary.originalSentence: You've reached the police non-emergency line. If it's life-threatening, hang up and dial triple zero. Otherwise, I'm here to take your report.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您已拨通警察非紧急热线。如果是人命关天的事，请挂断打000。其他情况，我可以帮您记录报案。

vocabulary.example: Hello, I just want to make sure if I got the right number.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您好，我想确认下，我没打错电话吧
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hello, I just want to make sure if I got the right number. I need to report a crime. I searched forever on my phone for this contact. Really hope you can help me out.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您好，我想确认下，我没打错电话吧？我要报个案子。手机查了半天，才找到这个号码。希望您能帮上忙。

vocabulary.example: Yep, you're in the right place for non-urgent stuff.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 对，非紧急案件打这儿没错
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yep, you're in the right place for non-urgent stuff. But if it's like a robbery in progress, we can't handle it here.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 对，非紧急案件打这儿没错。但要是抢劫正在发生，我们这儿处理不了。

vocabulary.example: No one is hurt. Not a violent crime, but the loss is bad.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 没人受伤不是啥暴力犯罪，可是，损失挺大的
vocabulary.originalSentence: No one is hurt. Not a violent crime, but the loss is bad. My construction site equipment is gone – I'm so worried.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 没人受伤。不是啥暴力犯罪，可是，损失挺大的。我工地的设备没了，急死我了。

vocabulary.example: Understood. Even a small incident can be upsetting for the person involved.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 明白再小的事，摊到当事人身上，也让人难受
vocabulary.originalSentence: Understood. Even a small incident can be upsetting for the person involved. Don't worry, we'll get this documented.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 明白。再小的事，摊到当事人身上，也让人难受。别急，我帮您登记。

vocabulary.example: The insurance company is withholding my compensation until they get the police case number.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 保险公司卡着不赔偿我，非得先要警方案件编号
vocabulary.originalSentence: The insurance company is withholding my compensation until they get the police case number. Otherwise, who would want to trouble the police?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 保险公司卡着不赔偿我，非得先要警方案件编号。不然，谁想麻烦警察啊！

vocabulary.example: Got it. Sounds like a theft, and your insurer needs proof.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 明白这听起来像是被盗，而且保险公司需要凭证
vocabulary.originalSentence: Got it. Sounds like a theft, and your insurer needs proof. Could you walk me through exactly what happened?

vocabulary.example: I run a construction company.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我是一个建筑公司的老板
vocabulary.originalSentence: I run a construction company. Last night, one of my managers left an excavator on the site, and it got stolen.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我是一个建筑公司的老板。昨天晚上，我的一个经理把挖掘机忘在工地上了，结果，就被偷了。

vocabulary.example: This type of equipment is always a prime target for thieves.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这种设备总是盗贼盯上的目标
vocabulary.originalSentence: This type of equipment is always a prime target for thieves. Even with locks in place, they will find a way to break in.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这种设备总是盗贼盯上的目标。即使上了锁，他们也会千方百计地进去。

vocabulary.example: Absolutely! Fortunately, we had insurance coverage.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 可不嘛幸亏买了保险东西找不回来，至少能拿钱
vocabulary.originalSentence: Absolutely! Fortunately, we had insurance coverage. Even if the item can't be recovered, at least we can get compensation. Otherwise, the company would face a cash flow crisis.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 可不嘛！幸亏买了保险。东西找不回来，至少能拿钱。不然，公司的现金流真要崩了。

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这次我等不及系统处理了

vocabulary.originalSentence: You're right. Water damage can compromise structural safety. I'll dispatch roofers immediately.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您说得对。漏水可能危害结构安全。我马上派屋顶维修工。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: You're right. Water damage can compromise structural safety. | I'll dispatch roofers immediately.
vocabulary.chineseDelimiterVersion: 您说得对漏水可能危害结构安全 | 我马上派屋顶维修工

vocabulary.example: Great! That's a lifesaver.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 太好了，救了我的命希望他们不用拆天花板
vocabulary.originalSentence: Great! That's a lifesaver. Hopefully they won't need to tear down the ceiling. I just finished decorating the bedroom.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了，救了我的命。希望他们不用拆天花板。我才刚刚布置好卧室啊。

vocabulary.example: Okay. I'll wait to hear from you.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 好的那我等你通知希望快点修好，别再漏水了
vocabulary.originalSentence: Okay. I'll wait to hear from you. Hope the repair gets done soon and the leaking stops. Thanks. Next time I need to report a repair, I'll do it online.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 好的。那我等你通知。希望快点修好，别再漏水了。谢谢你。下次再报修，我会在网上提交的。

vocabulary.example: Hey there! It's been ages since we chatted last.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 嗨
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hey there! It's been ages since we chatted last. I was just thinking about you the other day and wondering how things have been going on your end.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 嗨！咱好久没聊天了。我前几天还在想你，想着你这边最近怎么样呀。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: Hey there! It's been ages since we chatted last. | I was just thinking about you the other day and wondering how things have been going on your end.
vocabulary.chineseDelimiterVersion: 嗨 | 咱好久没聊天了我前几天还在想你，想着你这边最近怎么样呀

vocabulary.example: I've been renovating my backyard garden recently. It's finally done, and the plants are all in place.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 现在终于大功告成，花草都种好了
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yeah, it's been a while. I've been renovating my backyard garden recently. It's finally done, and the plants are all in place.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是啊，好久不见了。我这段时间一直在翻新后院花园。现在终于大功告成，花草都种好了。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: Yeah, it's been a while. | I've been renovating my backyard garden recently. It's finally done, and the plants are all in place.

vocabulary.example: That sounds awesome!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 听起来太棒了你重新设计的花园看着真是个大工程
vocabulary.originalSentence: That sounds awesome! Your garden redesign looked like a huge project. I hope it all turned out just the way you wanted.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 听起来太棒了！你重新设计的花园看着真是个大工程。希望一切都按你想的那样完成了。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: That sounds awesome! | Your garden redesign looked like a huge project. I hope it all turned out just the way you wanted.

vocabulary.example: It went really smoothly.

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 关键是得弄完以后能喜欢很多年，毕竟不想没过多久就重装一次。

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我也迫不及待想带你参观啦

vocabulary.example: Thanks for asking! Recently, I've been visiting my mother a lot.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢你的关心最近我常常去看我妈妈，她腿疼，身体还不太舒服
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thanks for asking! Recently, I've been visiting my mother a lot. She's been having leg pain and isn't feeling well, so I've been making time to see her.

vocabulary.example: Yeah, my mom prefers quiet places, so she lives in the suburbs.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是呀，我母亲不喜欢热闹，所以住在郊外
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yeah, my mom prefers quiet places, so she lives in the suburbs. It's a two-hour drive each way. I barely have any free time left.

vocabulary.example: My friend got some government payments last year.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我有个朋友去年也领过政府的一些补助
vocabulary.originalSentence: My friend got some government payments last year. You could try contacting the same office. Also, there are social worker directories available.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我有个朋友去年也领过政府的一些补助。你可以试着找同一个部门问问。另外，还有社工名录。

vocabulary.example: It's important to find someone with qualifications.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 找到有资质的人很重要
vocabulary.originalSentence: It's important to find someone with qualifications. Even if they can't help you directly, they'll know who can.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 找到有资质的人很重要。就算他们不能直接帮你，他们也一定知道谁可以帮你。

vocabulary.example: You're such a devoted child.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你很孝顺父母年纪大了，总是件难事

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你很孝顺。父母年纪大了，总是件难事。他们需要的照顾更多。

vocabulary.example: I'd like to ask a social worker to help my mother with a home safety assessment, like installing handrails and non-slip mats.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我想请社工帮妈妈做家庭安全评估，比如安装扶手和防滑垫
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'd like to ask a social worker to help my mother with a home safety assessment, like installing handrails and non-slip mats. That way she'll be safer in her place.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我想请社工帮妈妈做家庭安全评估，比如安装扶手和防滑垫。这样她在家里会更安全。

vocabulary.example: Insurance can be pricey, so it's important to choose the right level of cover so you're not overpaying.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 买保险确实不便宜，关键是得买到适合自己的保障，不至于多花钱
vocabulary.originalSentence: I totally get that. Insurance can be pricey, so it's important to choose the right level of cover so you're not overpaying.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我完全理解。买保险确实不便宜，关键是得买到适合自己的保障，不至于多花钱。

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 没错。我得想想，哪些东西是必须投保的。另外，还有别的方式，能让我每个月要交的保费少一些吗？

vocabulary.example: Paying yearly instead of monthly can save money.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 如果一次付一年的费用，通常会比按月付款省钱
vocabulary.originalSentence: Paying yearly instead of monthly can save money. But I get that you're just starting out, so it might be difficult to pay a lump sum.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 如果一次付一年的费用，通常会比按月付款省钱。不过，我知道你刚起步，所以一次付清可能会有点吃力。

vocabulary.example: I'm really excited about this new role and eager to fit in with the team.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢您抽时间见我，这份新工作让我非常激动，我也很想尽快融入团队

vocabulary.example: That's great news!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 太好了您能来这工作，我们也非常高兴
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's great news! We're thrilled to have you work here and we truly appreciate every new employee joining our company.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了！您能来这工作，我们也非常高兴。我们真心感激每位加入公司的新员工。

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我在接受这个职位前，和几位员工聊过

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我相信一定会的我以前没在这么大规模的公司工作

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 没错这样新人能顺利适应

vocabulary.example: That's great! Do you have a guidebook to help me settle in faster?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 真好你们有指导手册可以帮我更快融入吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's great! Do you have a guidebook to help me settle in faster? Also, the security guard who let me in said I need a staff ID card.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 真好。你们有指导手册可以帮我更快融入吗？还有，放我进来的保安说，我得有一个员工证。

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是的，你得用它进大楼和用电梯
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yes, you'll need it for building entry and elevator access. We'll take your photo and print the card right away. Then I'll introduce you to your mentor.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是的，你得用它进大楼和用电梯。我们会马上给你拍照做卡，然后我会带您去见您的导师。

vocabulary.example: And I even have a mentor?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 还有导师吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: And I even have a mentor? That's amazing! About the photo... I hope it won't turn out too bad. I've always hated taking ID photos.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 还有导师吗？真好！照片的话，希望不会太难看，我一向不太喜欢拍证件照。

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 欢迎来到我们的技能与就业中心
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Retail & Hospitality Jobs for New Migrant
vocabulary.originalSentence: Welcome to our skills and jobs Centre! I'm Noah, one of the advisors here. We offer free job search support. What can I help you with today?

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好，我是新移民我想找个活儿干

vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi, I'm a new immigrant. I'd like to find a job, but I'm not sure if my skills will match any suitable positions.

vocabulary.example: No worries. We've got a few over-the-counter drugs for indigestion.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 别担心
vocabulary.originalSentence: No worries. We've got a few over-the-counter drugs for indigestion. I'd suggest trying one that lowers stomach acid.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 别担心。我们有好几种非处方药可以缓解消化不良，我推荐您试试能抑制胃酸的那类药。

vocabulary.example: Thank you. How should I take the medicine?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢你这药我应该怎么吃呢
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thank you. How should I take the medicine? For example, before or after meals, and how many times a day?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 谢谢你。这药我应该怎么吃呢？比如，是饭前吃，还是饭后吃？一天要吃几次呢？

vocabulary.example: For acid reducers., You can take them right after eating.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 对于抑酸药，您可以一吃完东西就服用，或者，一感觉不舒服就吃。
vocabulary.originalSentence: For acid reducers, you can take them right after eating, or any time you start to feel discomfort.

vocabulary.example: Acid reducers are generally safe, though they may occasionally cause constipation or diarrhea.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 抑酸药通常很安全，但有时会导致便秘或腹泻
vocabulary.originalSentence: Acid reducers are generally safe, though they may occasionally cause constipation or diarrhea. Most folks handle them just fine.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 抑酸药通常很安全，但有时会导致便秘或腹泻。不过大多数人吃了都没事儿。

vocabulary.example: No problem. If you still feel off after a week.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 没问题
vocabulary.originalSentence: No problem. If you still feel off after a week, I'd recommend you see your GP to find out what's really going on.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 没问题。如果一周后还不舒服，建议找全科医生看看到底怎么了。

vocabulary.english: the wood around them is chipped
vocabulary.example: These hinges are worn, and the wood around them is chipped.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这些铰链已经磨损了，周围的木头也掉渣了
vocabulary.originalSentence: These hinges are worn, and the wood around them is chipped. I need to replace the hinges and patch up the wood.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这些铰链已经磨损了，周围的木头也掉渣了。得换铰链了，还得把木头补好。

vocabulary.example: Mornings tend to be less busy.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 通常早上人比较少，排队短，中午饭点儿之前的那阵子，人会更少。
vocabulary.originalSentence: Mornings tend to be less busy. The lines are shorter and it's less crowded before the lunch rush.

vocabulary.example: The information is so helpful.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这些信息太有帮助了罗宾，认识你真好
vocabulary.originalSentence: The information is so helpful. Robin, it's really nice meeting you. Coffee's on me once I'm all settled!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这些信息太有帮助了。罗宾，认识你真好。我一安顿好，就请你去喝咖啡！

vocabulary.example: Hi there, I'm one of the paramedics.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好，我是其中一位急救人员
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi there, I'm one of the paramedics. You said you made the call earlier. Can you walk me through what happened?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好，我是其中一位急救人员。你说刚才是你打的电话。你能给我详细说说发生了什么吗？

vocabulary.example: Hi. Just now, this man suddenly collapsed right in front of me.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好，这位男士刚才就在我面前突然倒下了，我看到他晕倒在地上了。
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi. Just now, this man suddenly collapsed right in front of me. I saw him faint on the ground.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好，这位男士刚才就在我面前突然倒下了，我看到他晕倒在地上了。

vocabulary.example: Do you know how long he's been unconscious?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你知道他昏迷多久了吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: Do you know how long he's been unconscious? Did you see any warning signs before he went down?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你知道他昏迷多久了吗？他倒下前，有没有表现出任何预兆？

vocabulary.example: About two minutes.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 有两分钟左右了
vocabulary.originalSentence: About two minutes. Before he collapsed, he was a bit unsteady and looked very pale.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 有两分钟左右了。倒下之前，他有点站不稳，脸色也很苍白。

vocabulary.example: I'm going to check his pulse and breathing right away.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我现在马上检查他的脉搏和呼吸情况
vocabulary.originalSentence: Got it, thanks for the heads-up. I'm going to check his pulse and breathing right away.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 明白，多谢告知。我现在马上检查他的脉搏和呼吸情况。

vocabulary.example: Is this a heart attack?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这像是心脏病发作了我还能帮上什么忙吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: Is this a heart attack? What else can I do to help, like look for medication?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这像是心脏病发作了？我还能帮上什么忙吗？比如找药什么的？

vocabulary.example: I'm not certain yet.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 现在还不确定
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm not certain yet. Please stay calm and move back a bit so I have room to work.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 现在还不确定。请保持冷静，后退一点儿，好让我有空间操作。

vocabulary.example: No problem, I'll step back.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 没问题我往后退一点我刚给打电话叫了救护车
vocabulary.originalSentence: No problem, I'll step back. I just called an ambulance. How long does it take for the ambulance to arrive?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 没问题。我往后退一点。我刚给打电话叫了救护车。救护车还有多久到？

vocabulary.example: The ambulance is minutes away.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 救护车几分钟就到
vocabulary.originalSentence: The ambulance is minutes away. Right now, I'm looking for any injuries from the fall, especially around his head and spine.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 救护车几分钟就到。我现在在检查他的摔伤情况，特别是头部和脊椎附近。

vocabulary.example: I think I saw his head hit the ground just now.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我刚才好像看到他头部撞到地了
vocabulary.originalSentence: I think I saw his head hit the ground just now. Should we put something soft under his head?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我刚才好像看到他头部撞到地了。需要在他脑袋下面，垫点软的东西吗？

vocabulary.example: It's better to leave him as he is for now, until we assess him properly.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 在我们好好检查他之前，最好先让他保持现状
vocabulary.originalSentence: It's better to leave him as he is for now, until we assess him properly. Moving him may cause further injury.

vocabulary.example: I hope you're already settling in. It must be a big change for you to live in this small town. If you need anything, just let me know.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 住在这么小的镇上，对你来说，肯定是个很大的改变如果你需要什么，随时告诉我

vocabulary.example: Yeah, I've never lived in a town this small before.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是啊，我从来没在这么小的镇子上住过呢
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Friendly Support for the New Town Doctor
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yeah, I've never lived in a town this small before. And it's really a bit far from the city. Driving to the nearest shops takes around 30 minutes.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是啊，我从来没在这么小的镇子上住过呢。而且，这里离市区也真的有点远。到最近的几个店，都要开车大概半小时。

vocabulary.example: Yes, it takes a while for you to get used to it.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是的，要适应得一段时间呢
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Friendly Support for the New Town Doctor
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yes, it takes a while for you to get used to it. I hope the sense of community can make it up. After all, everyone knows each other here.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是的，要适应得一段时间呢。我希望这里的社区氛围能弥补这点。毕竟，这里大家互相都认识。

vocabulary.example: The people in this small town are all really lovely.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这个小镇上的人都很可爱
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Friendly Support for the New Town Doctor
vocabulary.originalSentence: The people in this small town are all really lovely. I'm adjusting well. My little clinic has been open for over six months, and through work I've met nearly half the town.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这个小镇上的人都很可爱。我适应得还不错。我的小诊所已经开了半年多，通过工作，我也认识了镇上大半的人。

vocabulary.example: I'm sure everyone is excited about the new doctor.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我肯定大家都对新医生感到很兴奋
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Friendly Support for the New Town Doctor
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm sure everyone is excited about the new doctor. The previous doctor moved back to the city. It took a while for the replacement doctor to arrive.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我肯定大家都对新医生感到很兴奋。之前的医生搬回城里了。过了好一阵子，才有替代的医生来。

vocabulary.example: I don't plan to move back right now.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 现在，我并不打算搬回去
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Friendly Support for the New Town Doctor
vocabulary.originalSentence: I don't plan to move back right now, but I do really miss all the events, things, and shops in the city.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 现在，我并不打算搬回去。但是，我确实很想念城市里的各种活动、很多东西，还有许多商店。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Friendly Support for the New Town Doctor
vocabulary.originalSentence: Great, we bought a few bags of coffee beans when we just moved here, but after nearly half a year, we've almost run out of them.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了，我们刚搬来时，买了几包咖啡豆。但是，快半年了，咖啡快喝完了。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Friendly Support for the New Town Doctor
vocabulary.originalSentence: You are not the only one. I will see if I can get your roast coffee delivered from my shop. If it arrives in good time, I'll let you know right away.

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 非常感谢你

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 非常感谢你。说不定你订了这些货之后，小镇上的其他居民也会很喜欢购买的。

vocabulary.example: I got your voicemail and I'm just calling you back. Is everything okay?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我收到你的语音留言，给你回电请问一切都还好吗

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我知道您是新租客，但您有任何问题，最好在网上告知我们，这样我们能有书面记录。

vocabulary.delimiterVersion: I know you are a new tenant with our company. | But it is best to notify us of any issues online., So we can have a written record.
vocabulary.chineseDelimiterVersion: 我知道您是新租客，但您有任何问题，最好在网上告知我们，这样我们能有书面记录。

vocabulary.example: Oh okay. I didn't know that before, but what you said makes sense.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 哦，好的我之前不知道，不过，您说的有道理

vocabulary.example: This morning, I had a work meeting.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 今天早上，我有个工作会议
vocabulary.originalSentence: This morning, I had a work meeting. When I went to the kitchen to make breakfast before sunrise, it was still dark outside. And then, I saw a mouse.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 今天早上，我有个工作会议。我去厨房准备早餐的时候，天还没亮呢。结果，我看到了一只老鼠！

vocabulary.example: Of course not! As you know, I just moved in last week.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 当然没有啊你知道的，我上周才搬进来
vocabulary.originalSentence: Of course not! As you know, I just moved in last week. The mouse must have been there already. Mice are such horrible creatures!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 当然没有啊。你知道的，我上周才搬进来。老鼠肯定早就在那儿了。老鼠这种动物太可怕了！

vocabulary.example: Yes, you're right. They are not healthy, and they can also damage our homes.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是的，您说得对老鼠不卫生，还会破坏我们的房子
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yes, you're right. They are not healthy, and they can also damage our homes. I will call the pest control company to help.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是的，您说得对。老鼠不卫生，还会破坏我们的房子。我会打电话给害虫防治公司来处理。

vocabulary.example: Thank you, that's great.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢，那太好了我可不喜欢和那种有害的动物住在一起
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thank you, that's great. I really don't want to live with those kinds of pests. They can spread germs.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 谢谢，那太好了。我可不喜欢和那种有害的动物住在一起。它们可能传播病菌。

vocabulary.example: I always pay my monthly bills quite late.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我支付每个月的账单都比较晚
vocabulary.originalSentence: I always pay my monthly bills quite late. After I've paid the money, I still receive payment reminder messages from the billing company.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我支付每个月的账单都比较晚。我付了钱以后，还是会收到账单方的催款短信。

vocabulary.example: Some payments are still pending. Payments can take up to 2 days to go through.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 部分交易还在处理，到账最多需要2个工作日
vocabulary.originalSentence: It probably happens because you're paying on the due date. Some payments are still pending. Payments can take up to 2 days to go through.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 估计是因为您踩着截止日付款。部分交易还在处理，到账最多需要2个工作日。

vocabulary.example: I see. So the money is definitely deducted from my account.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我懂了

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我懂了。意思就是，钱确实从我的账户里划走了，但收款人不能马上能收到钱。

vocabulary.example: You've got the right line for non-emergency reports.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您拨打的是非紧急报案电话
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: You've got the right line for non-emergency reports. If it's urgent, you'll need to hang up and dial 000.

vocabulary.example: It's not an emergency, it's just that my van was stolen.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 不是紧急的，就是我的面包车被偷了
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: It's not an emergency, it's just that my van was stolen. It was stolen from where I was working yesterday. But I'm physically fine.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 不是紧急的，就是我的面包车被偷了。是在我昨天工作的地方被偷的。不过我人没事。

vocabulary.example: Discovering something stolen is always upsetting.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 发现东西被偷总是让人心烦
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: Discovering something stolen is always upsetting. Even non-urgent matters can be serious. Let's go over what happened so I can assist you.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 发现东西被偷总是让人心烦。就算不算紧急，也可以是很严重的。我们过一下事情经过吧，我好帮你处理。

vocabulary.english: the main thing is that it
vocabulary.example: The main thing is that it's my work vehicle, losing it is a real headache.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 主要是，这车是我干活用的，丢了很麻烦
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: The main thing is that it's my work vehicle, losing it is a real headache. The insurance company wants me to get a police report first, then I can file a claim.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 主要是，这车是我干活用的，丢了很麻烦。保险公司让我先搞个报案单，然后才能申请赔付。

vocabulary.example: Understood, work vehicles are crucial.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 明白了，工作车辆很重要
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: Understood, work vehicles are crucial. So, a van was taken? Sounds like you need a theft report for the insurer. Tell me where and when you last saw it.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 明白了，工作车辆很重要。那么，被偷的是一辆面包车？听起来你需要给保险公司提供一份盗窃报案单。告诉我你最后见到它的地点和时间。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: Understood, work vehicles are crucial. So, a van was taken? Sounds like you need a theft report for the insurer. Tell me where and when you last saw it.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 明白了，工作车辆很重要。那么，被偷的是一辆面包车？听起来你需要给保险公司提供一份盗窃报案单。告诉我你最后见到它的地点和时间。

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 昨天上午，我在建筑工地干活。大概中午那会儿，发现我的面包车给人偷了。

vocabulary.example: Oh no, that's terrible!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 哎呀，这太糟了面包车是小偷的常见目标
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: Oh no, that's terrible! Vans are common targets for thieves. Whether the vehicle is locked or not, they know how to break in quickly.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 哎呀，这太糟了！面包车是小偷的常见目标。不管车子有没有锁，他们都知道怎么快速弄开。

vocabulary.example: I locked it up, but there was no anti-theft alarm.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 车我锁好了，但没安防盗报警
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: I locked it up, but there was no anti-theft alarm. If there had been an alarm, it might have scared the thief off.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 车我锁好了，但没安防盗报警。要是有报警器，可能就把贼吓跑了。

vocabulary.example: Getting an alarm is definitely smart.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 装报警器当然很明智
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: Getting an alarm is definitely smart. But those pros can work so fast that sometimes an alarm doesn't even slow them down.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 装报警器当然很明智。但那些专业小偷的动作太快，以至于有时候报警器甚至都拦不住他们。

vocabulary.example: This shows the value of insurance.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这件事就能显出保险的价值了
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: This shows the value of insurance. Even if my van can't be recovered in the end, I can at least get the payout.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这件事就能显出保险的价值了。就算我的面包车最终找不回来，至少我还能拿到赔偿金。

vocabulary.example: Please tell me a few more details.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 请多告诉我几个细节，比如地点、时间、有无目击者，然后我会给您一个报案编号，您可以提供给保险公司。
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: Please tell me a few more details, like the location, time, any witnesses, and I'll give you a report reference number for your insurer.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 请多告诉我几个细节，比如地点、时间、有无目击者，然后我会给您一个报案编号，您可以提供给保险公司。

vocabulary.example: Thank you. As soon as I get the case number, I'll contact the insurance company right away.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 感谢你一拿到报案号，我就马上联系保险公司
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Van Theft Report and Insurance Steps
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thank you. As soon as I get the case number, I'll contact the insurance company right away. That van was bought with my hard-earned money!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 感谢你。一拿到报案号，我就马上联系保险公司。这个面包车可是我的血汗钱买的啊！

vocabulary.example: Hello, I want to ask about the dog-walking regulations here.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好，我想咨询一下这里遛狗的法律法规
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hello, I want to ask about the dog-walking regulations here. I heard some neighbours get startled when they see dogs, so I'd like to know the rules first.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好，我想咨询一下这里遛狗的法律法规。听说有些邻居看到狗就吓一跳，所以我想先搞清楚规矩。

vocabulary.example: Absolutely! Having a dog means following rules.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 当然可以养狗意味着要守规矩
vocabulary.originalSentence: Absolutely! Having a dog means following rules. We've got straightforward regulations to keep everyone safe. Have you had a chance to check any local regulations?

vocabulary.example: I'm not really sure about the details.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 具体还真的不太清楚
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm not really sure about the details. I just know I have to leash my dog, but when it comes to details like whether dogs are allowed on the beach, I'm completely lost.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 具体还真的不太清楚。我就知道得给狗拴上牵绳，但是，像狗狗能不能去海滩这些细节，我就懵了。

vocabulary.example: Your dog needs to be leashed in public spaces.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 在公共区域必须给狗拴牵绳
vocabulary.originalSentence: Your dog needs to be leashed in public spaces. However, we have two designated off-leash parks where they can roam. Also, the southern section of the beach is also leash-free!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 在公共区域必须给狗拴牵绳。不过，我们有两个专门的无牵绳公园，可以让狗狗自由奔跑。海滩的南段也允许放开牵绳。

vocabulary.example: That's great. My dog loves splashing around in the water, rolling in the sand, and chasing seagulls.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 太棒了我的狗特别喜欢在水里踩来踩去，在沙子里打滚，还会追那些海鸥
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's great. My dog loves splashing around in the water, rolling in the sand, and chasing seagulls. Are there any spots where dogs aren't allowed?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太棒了。我的狗特别喜欢在水里踩来踩去，在沙子里打滚，还会追那些海鸥。请问有哪些地方是不允许狗狗去的吗？

vocabulary.example: Indeed, dogs aren't allowed in certain spots like kids' playgrounds, sports ovals, and some beaches.

vocabulary.example: Hi there, I'd like to report a driver in our apartment complex who keeps speeding.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您好，我要投诉我们公寓小区里有位司机开车一直超速
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Resident Alerts Police to Speeding Driver
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi there, I'd like to report a driver in our apartment complex who keeps speeding. We all think it's really dangerous. Also, the car's engine seems really powerful and super loud.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您好，我要投诉我们公寓小区里有位司机开车一直超速。我们都觉得很危险。而且感觉车子发动机很强，非常吵。

vocabulary.example: Thanks for that.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 感谢您的信息
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Resident Alerts Police to Speeding Driver
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thanks for that. Have you heard if anyone else has noticed this, or if this driver has been involved in any other incidents?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 感谢您的信息。您知道有没有其他人也注意到这事，或者这个司机还有没有发生过别的事故？

vocabulary.example: Plenty of our neighbours have seen him too and are almost scared stiff of him.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 好多邻居都看到过呢，对他都快闻风丧胆了
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Resident Alerts Police to Speeding Driver
vocabulary.originalSentence: Plenty of our neighbours have seen him too and are almost scared stiff of him. He drives insanely fast, and we're all really worried about the kids' safety.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 好多邻居都看到过呢，对他都快闻风丧胆了。他开车像疯了一样快，我们都很担心孩子们的安全。

vocabulary.example: I understand. I'll dispatch a patrol car to monitor the area at those times.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我明白
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Resident Alerts Police to Speeding Driver
vocabulary.originalSentence: I understand. I'll dispatch a patrol car to monitor the area at those times, and if we can pinpoint the driver, we'll have a word with him.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我明白。我会在那个时段派巡逻警车去监控那个区域，如果我们能确认司机身份，我们会跟他谈谈的。

vocabulary.example: Thank you, officer. We all hope he can understand the consequences of what he has done and can stop speeding.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢警察同志我们都希望他能明白这样做的后果，不要再超速了
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Resident Alerts Police to Speeding Driver

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我会盯着他的非常感谢你们的协助
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Resident Alerts Police to Speeding Driver

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢希望早点抓到那个坏蛋，给他点教训

vocabulary.example: I totally get it. This area's super convenient, with the mall and the park nearby.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我完全明白这地段多方便啊，商场公园都在旁边
vocabulary.originalSentence: I totally get it. This area's super convenient, with the mall and the park nearby. If you moved elsewhere, you'd have to re-learn everything all over again.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我完全明白。这地段多方便啊，商场公园都在旁边。要是搬到别的地方，你就得重新熟悉一遍周边环境。

vocabulary.example: That's a shame. But it's smart to stick to your budget.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 真可惜，不过，量入为出是对的
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's a shame. But it's smart to stick to your budget. Don't worry, it doesn't mean you won't find something you love. There's plenty of fish in the sea.

vocabulary.example: We'd like an empty property — that keeps things simple.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们希望能买一套空房子，这样一切都简单
vocabulary.originalSentence: We'd like an empty property — that keeps things simple. I don't like houses cluttered with furniture and stuff; I don't think we could move into one like that.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我们希望能买一套空房子，这样一切都简单。我不喜欢到处堆满家具和杂物的房子。我觉得我们没办法搬进那样的房子。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: We'd like an empty property — that keeps things simple. | I don't like houses cluttered with furniture and stuff; I don't think we could move into one like that.

vocabulary.example: You may want to focus on the floor plan, rather than getting distracted by the furnishings.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 或许，你们可以关注房子的户型图，而不是被家具干扰
vocabulary.originalSentence: You may want to focus on the floor plan, rather than getting distracted by the furnishings. Decorations can always be changed later.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 或许，你们可以关注房子的户型图，而不是被家具干扰。房子的装饰到后面都能改的。

vocabulary.example: Some layouts just won't work for us; we don't want a two-story home—we prefer a single-level place.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 有些户型我们就是接受不了。我们不想要复式，只想要平层。

vocabulary.example: It might be worth checking out some of the older homes in the area.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 或许可以看看这个区一些年代久一些的房子——它们往往更符合你们的需求
vocabulary.originalSentence: It might be worth checking out some of the older homes in the area. They often match what you're looking for. I can help you find them.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 或许可以看看这个区一些年代久一些的房子——它们往往更符合你们的需求。我可以帮你找找。

vocabulary.example: Thank you. We don't want major renovations.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢你我们不想大改结构
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thank you. We don't want major renovations. At most, we'd just tweak the layout of one or two rooms.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 谢谢你。我们不想大改结构。最多，微调一两个房间的布局，就可以啦。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: Thank you. We don't want major renovations. | At most, we'd just tweak the layout of one or two rooms.

vocabulary.example: Actually, there's one property that could be perfect, but it's not officially listed.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 其实，有一处房产可能很合适，但房子还没挂牌呢
vocabulary.originalSentence: Actually, there's one property that could be perfect, but it's not officially listed. I know the owner personally, and can set up an inspection.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 其实，有一处房产可能很合适，但房子还没挂牌呢。我认识屋主，可以帮你们安排看房。

vocabulary.example: Fantastic! Please help arrange it for us.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 太好了帮我们安排一下吧
vocabulary.originalSentence: Fantastic! Please help arrange it for us. Fingers crossed this works out! I really hope this house will meet our family's needs.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了。帮我们安排一下吧。希望这次能成。真希望这套房子能满足我们全家的需求啊。

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好，这里是电器商店
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi there, this is the appliance shop speaking. My name is Adrian. How can I assist you today?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好，这里是电器商店。我是艾德利安。今天我能为您做点什么？

vocabulary.example: Hey there! I bought a washing machine from you guys a while back, but it's been faulty lately.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hey there! I bought a washing machine from you guys a while back, but it's been faulty lately. It always makes a piercing noise, and I've been too scared to use it for a week.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好！我前段时间在你们这里买了一台洗衣机，但最近坏掉了，总是发出尖锐的噪音，吓得我已经一周没用它了。

vocabulary.example: Oh no, sorry to hear that.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 哎呀，听到这些我很抱歉
vocabulary.originalSentence: Oh no, sorry to hear that. Do you remember exactly when you bought it? If it's still under warranty, we might be able to fix it at no cost.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 哎呀，听到这些我很抱歉。你还记得具体什么时候买吗？如果还在保修期内，我们可能可以免费维修。

vocabulary.example: I bought it five months ago, and it was working great.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我是五个月前买的，之前一直运转得挺不错的，我原本还挺满意的
vocabulary.originalSentence: I bought it five months ago, and it was working great. I was actually pretty happy with it. But now it's getting so noisy and it's even leaking water.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我是五个月前买的，之前一直运转得挺不错的，我原本还挺满意的。结果现在噪音又刺耳，又漏水。

vocabulary.example: That should still be covered.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 这应该还在保修范围内
vocabulary.originalSentence: That should still be covered. Would you prefer getting it repaired, or would you rather we replace it for you?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这应该还在保修范围内。你希望我们修理它，还是换一台新的给你？

vocabulary.example: Does that mean I don't have to pay?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是说我不用出钱修吗我有点搞不清保修是什么意思
vocabulary.originalSentence: Does that mean I don't have to pay? I'm not too sure what warranty really means. Is repair usually expensive?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是说我不用出钱修吗？我有点搞不清保修是什么意思。维修费用是不是都很高啊？

vocabulary.example: Exactly. Warranty means we'll cover the repair or even replace it for free.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 没错
vocabulary.originalSentence: Exactly. Warranty means we'll cover the repair or even replace it for free, as long as the issue wasn't caused by misuse.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 没错。保修就是在一定时间内，只要不是人为损坏，维修或更换都是免费的。

vocabulary.example: Great. I was worried I'd have to pay out of pocket.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 太好了我之前还担心得自己掏钱修
vocabulary.originalSentence: Great. I was worried I'd have to pay out of pocket. Then I'm relieved. I'd prefer to get the original machine fixed.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了。我之前还担心得自己掏钱修。那我就放心了。我还是想把原机修好。

vocabulary.example: I wanted to talk with you about how to raise some money for our school band, so the kids can have more funds to go on music tours.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我之前是想跟你讨论，怎么给我们的学校乐队筹集资金，让孩子们有更多资金参加音乐巡演

vocabulary.example: Hi! So far, I've just figured out the supermarket and the school.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好我暂时只摸清了超市和学校
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Newcomer Navigates Waste Sorting and Gardening
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi! So far, I've just figured out the supermarket and the school. But yesterday I noticed the waste sorting system here is quite different. I was just wanting to ask someone about it.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 你好。我暂时只摸清了超市和学校。不过，昨天我发现，这里的垃圾分类很不同。我正想找人问问呢。

vocabulary.originalSentence: Like, why are there three different colored bins? And what waste needs separate handling?

vocabulary.english: the red lid is for general waste
vocabulary.example: Well, the red lid is for general waste, the yellow one is for recycling, and the green one is for organics.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 嗯，红色盖子装普通垃圾，黄色回收，绿色有机垃圾
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Newcomer Navigates Waste Sorting and Gardening
vocabulary.originalSentence: Well, the red lid is for general waste, the yellow one is for recycling, and the green one is for organics. Some items, like batteries, need special drop-off. Most supermarkets take them.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 嗯，红色盖子装普通垃圾，黄色回收，绿色有机垃圾。像电池这种特殊物品要单独处理。多数超市都有回收点。

vocabulary.example: The City Council holds an e-waste collection day quarterly.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 市政厅会每个季度办电子垃圾回收日，下次在十月，地点在社区中心。
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Newcomer Navigates Waste Sorting and Gardening
vocabulary.originalSentence: The City Council holds an e-waste collection day quarterly. The next one will be in October, at the community centre.

vocabulary.originalSentence: Great. I didn't bring any gardening tools with me when I moved here. The shipping costs are too high. So now I've got to buy everything again.

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了。我搬家的时候啥园艺工具都没带过来。运费实在太贵了。所以现在我得重新添置一批。

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了。我已经迫不及待想种点东西了，就是这边的环境跟我的祖国那边差很多。

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 要不我现在陪你去园艺中心？我们可以选些适合本地土壤的植物。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hey! The first few months were really tough, but gladly business is getting busy now. Compared to before, I'm way busier these days!

vocabulary.example: Actually, I could lend a hand.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 实际上，我可以帮你一把
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: Actually, I could lend a hand. You probably saw that I got a skip bin delivered here last month.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 实际上，我可以帮你一把。你可能看到了上个月我这送来一个大型垃圾箱。

vocabulary.example: Of course I saw that huge skip bin!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 那么大的垃圾箱，我当然看到啦
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: Of course I saw that huge skip bin! You're using it to clean out the warehouse, right? You must have a ton of junk!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 那么大的垃圾箱，我当然看到啦！你是打算用它清理仓库垃圾吗？你的垃圾肯定不少啊！

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: Funny enough, I don't. It turned out much bigger than I thought. It's only half full at the moment. Do you need to use it for your trash?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 搞笑的是，我其实没多少垃圾。这箱子比我想象的大多了，现在才装了半箱。你要用这箱子扔你的垃圾吗？

vocabulary.example: Perfect! Thank you! I doubt the previous owner never cleared the junk.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 求之不得
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: Perfect! Thank you! I doubt the previous owner never cleared the junk. I could easily fill this skip bin!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 求之不得！谢谢你！我怀疑前一个业主压根没处理过垃圾，我能轻松就能把垃圾箱装满。

vocabulary.example: Perfect! Make use of it!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 太好了赶紧用起来空着不用太浪费了
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: Perfect! Make use of it! It'd be a shame to let it sit empty. Hiring it costs a lot!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 太好了！赶紧用起来！空着不用太浪费了。租这东西可不便宜啊！

vocabulary.example: I know how expensive it is to hire a skip bin, especially for a whole week.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我知道租大垃圾箱有多贵，特别是租一周的话
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: I know how expensive it is to hire a skip bin, especially for a whole week. Want me to chip in? Or I could give your car a service as a thank you! — you just saved me a ton of hassle!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我知道租大垃圾箱有多贵，特别是租一周的话。你要我帮你分担一下费用吗？或者我可以给你的车提供一次保养，来感谢你给我用垃圾箱，这帮我省掉了大麻烦。

vocabulary.example: I'd really appreciate your generous offer!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 感谢你这么大方太好了

vocabulary.originalSentence: I'd really appreciate your generous offer! Fantastic! My car's due for a service anyway, so that's perfect.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 感谢你这么大方！太好了！我车本来也该保养了，这下正好。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Making Use of a Spare Skip Bin
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thanks. Just say the word if you need a hand hauling the junk. I'll leave the skip bin here till the weekend.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 谢谢。如果需要帮忙搬垃圾，跟我说一声。我会把垃圾箱留到周末。

vocabulary.example: I just know she likes that biography.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我只知道她喜欢那本人物传记
vocabulary.originalSentence: I just know she likes that biography. As for what other books she loves to read, I honestly don't know. Rather than racking my brains and possibly still failing to give her a gift she truly loves, I might as well take her out for dim sum.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我只知道她喜欢那本人物传记。至于她还爱看什么其他书，我还真的不知道。与其说绞尽脑汁也可能送不到她心仪的礼物，不如我请她去吃个广式早茶。

vocabulary.example: I totally understand.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我完全理解
vocabulary.originalSentence: I totally understand. Buying real estate is a big investment, and even when things go smoothly, the process itself can be quite stressful.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我完全理解。买房是一笔大投资，就算一切顺利，过程本身也非常让人紧张。

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 确实啊，事情不太顺利。昨天我刚和卖家签了合同。但是，我之后又发现了一些问题。

vocabulary.example: Could you clarify the issues?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您能具体说明是什么问题吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: Could you clarify the issues? Is it about the building itself, or maybe pet-related? We'll check the contract and resolve them for you.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您能具体说明是什么问题吗？是关于房屋本身的问题，还是宠物相关的问题？我们会查阅合同内容，为您解决问题。

vocabulary.example: I understand. Since you signed only yesterday.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我明白了
vocabulary.originalSentence: I understand. Since you signed only yesterday, you could invoke the cooling-off period clause to get your deposit back.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我明白了。既然您是昨天才签的合同，你可以利用合同中的冷静期条款，把定金拿回来。

vocabulary.example: Can you please help me?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 您能帮帮我吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: Can you please help me? I've been saving every penny for years to buy this property. I can't afford to lose this deposit!
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 您能帮帮我吗？这几年我为了买房，节衣缩食地存钱，我承担不起这笔定金损失啊。

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们明天见面，您有空吗
vocabulary.originalSentence: Would you be available to meet tomorrow? I'll bring all the documents with me. Thank you. I really hope to get your help as soon as possible.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我们明天见面，您有空吗？我会带着所有的文件的。谢谢您，真希望能尽快得到帮助。

vocabulary.example: Welcome inside! I've got around half an hour before the morning rush hits.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 请进我还有大约半小时，之后就早高峰了
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Pitching Baked Goods to a Café
vocabulary.originalSentence: Welcome inside! I've got around half an hour before the morning rush hits. You said before you wanted to pitch your products?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 请进！我还有大约半小时，之后就早高峰了。你之前说想给我推介一下你的产品？

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢，我知道你们的咖啡店早上最忙，我不会耽误你太久的。

vocabulary.example: That's right. Most of our trade happens in the morning.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是啊，我们大部分的生意都集中在上午，下午就很冷清
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Pitching Baked Goods to a Café
vocabulary.originalSentence: That's right. Most of our trade happens in the morning. Afternoons are pretty quiet. Folks around here tend to clock in and out early.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是啊，我们大部分的生意都集中在上午，下午就很冷清。这附近的人上下班都挺早的。

vocabulary.example: I know most of your customers are construction workers and tradespeople, and I think they'll love my products.

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Pitching Baked Goods to a Café
vocabulary.originalSentence: I know most of your customers are construction workers and tradespeople, and I think they'll love my products. You name the quantity, and I can supply it.

vocabulary.example: I'm always on the lookout for new offerings.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我总是对新产品很感兴趣
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Pitching Baked Goods to a Café
vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm always on the lookout for new offerings. I make my own sandwiches and salads, but I also source from suppliers like you.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我总是对新产品很感兴趣。我自己做三明治和沙拉，但也会从像您这样的供应商那里拿货。

vocabulary.example: I specialize in baking.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我擅长烘焙，尤其是蛋糕和饼干
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Pitching Baked Goods to a Café
vocabulary.originalSentence: I specialize in baking, especially cakes and cookies—my recipes come straight from my grandmother.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我擅长烘焙，尤其是蛋糕和饼干。这些食谱都是我祖母传下来的。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Pitching Baked Goods to a Café
vocabulary.originalSentence: Well, I think your products would fit my café perfectly. Can you come by with some samples this week?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 嗯，我觉得你的产品会非常适合我的咖啡馆。你这周能带些样品过来吗？

vocabulary.example: Sure thing. No problem.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 当然可以，没问题的我会带上产品目录和批发价表
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Pitching Baked Goods to a Café
vocabulary.originalSentence: Sure thing. No problem. I'll bring my product catalogue and wholesale price list. Is Thursday good for you?

vocabulary.example: Hi, sorry I'm late.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 你好，不好意思我迟到了，你今天组织了这么盛大的活动呀。

vocabulary.originalSentence: Hi, sorry I'm late. You've organized such a grand event today.

vocabulary.example: Thank you! It's been a long time since we last met.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 谢谢我们很久没见了我一直想安排一次下午茶
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids
vocabulary.originalSentence: Thank you! It's been a long time since we last met. I've been thinking of arranging an afternoon tea. I hope nothing bad happened to make you late?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 谢谢！我们很久没见了。我一直想安排一次下午茶。希望你不是遇到什么麻烦才迟到的？

vocabulary.example: No, not at all. I planned to pick up my kid from school this afternoon.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 不是，完全不是
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids
vocabulary.originalSentence: No, not at all. I planned to pick up my kid from school this afternoon. So I walked there and back.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 不是，完全不是。我下午计划去学校接孩子放学，所以我走路去，又走路回来的。

vocabulary.example: Sounds like a great adventure!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 听起来像一次大冒险我从来没走过
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids
vocabulary.originalSentence: Sounds like a great adventure! I've never tried walking there before. It must have taken you a long time to get there and back, right?

vocabulary.example: Yeah, it took longer than I expected, but the route wasn't difficult.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 嗯，比我预期的要久，但路并不难走
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yeah, it took longer than I expected, but the route wasn't difficult. I cut through the park instead of taking the main road.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 嗯，比我预期的要久，但路并不难走。我从公园穿过去，没有沿着主路走。

vocabulary.example: I wish I could walk with my kids like that.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我真希望能这样和孩子们一起走着上学
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids
vocabulary.originalSentence: I wish I could walk with my kids like that. But I've been swamped lately. Even driving to pick them up is tough.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我真希望能这样和孩子们一起走着上学。但最近我太忙了，连开车去接他们都难。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids
vocabulary.originalSentence: I plan to do this regularly. If you like, I can pick up your child for you over the next few days. I'm off work in the afternoons, so it's easy for me. You wouldn't have to make a special trip to the school.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我打算经常这样做。如果你愿意，这几天我可以帮你接孩子。下午我不上班，对我来说很方便。你就不用专门跑一趟学校了。

vocabulary.example: Wow, that would be a huge help!

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids
vocabulary.originalSentence: Wow, that would be a huge help! I'm sure my kids would enjoy walking! It's good exercise for them. As long as you don't mind, of course. I hope it's not a bother.

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Easy Ways to Pick Up Our Kids

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 刚买的时候都还好，我很满意的。但是用了两三个星期之后，它就开始发烫了，我不得不关机。它还会开始随意自动关机。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: It worked fine at first, and I was very happy with it. | But after 2-3 weeks, it started getting too hot, so I had to turn it off. It even began shutting down by itself randomly.
vocabulary.chineseDelimiterVersion: 刚买的时候都还好，我很满意的 | 但是用了两三个星期之后，它就开始发烫了，我不得不关机它还会开始随意自动关机

vocabulary.example: Yeah., Laptops do get warm.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 明白
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Fixing a Faulty Laptop Under Warranty
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yeah, laptops do get warm, depending on what you're doing, and your room temperature, but they shouldn't be overheating.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 明白。笔记本在使用过程中会发热，跟工作内容和室温有关，但不该这么烫的。

vocabulary.example: I use this computer for business documents.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我用这个电脑处理商务文件的
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Fixing a Faulty Laptop Under Warranty
vocabulary.originalSentence: I use this computer for business documents. Every time I work on files with it, they get lost. This is driving me crazy, and I can't figure out what's wrong.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我用这个电脑处理商务文件的。无论什么资料，处理的时候都会丢失。这事搞得我很烦，我也不知道是哪出了问题。

vocabulary.example: Oh, no! It might be a busted fan, a battery issue, or something on the software side.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 哎呀可能是风扇坏了，可能是电池问题，也可能是软件方面的故障
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Fixing a Faulty Laptop Under Warranty

vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 哎呀！可能是风扇坏了，可能是电池问题，也可能是软件方面的故障。我得检查一下才能确定。

vocabulary.example: So I need to leave the laptop here, right?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 那我是不是得把电脑放在这
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Fixing a Faulty Laptop Under Warranty
vocabulary.originalSentence: So I need to leave the laptop here, right? I've backed up everything already—I'm just worried something might get lost during the repair.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 那我是不是得把电脑放在这？我已经把文件都备份好了，我就是怕修电脑的时候资料会丢。

vocabulary.example: We could start a social media donation campaign and get news coverage to spread the word.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我们可以发起社交媒体捐赠活动，还可以用新闻报道来宣传，呼吁大家多捐款和食物，来充实我们的食品库。
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Using Media and Web to Boost Food Donations
vocabulary.originalSentence: We could start a social media donation campaign and get news coverage to spread the word. Let's ask people to donate more money and food to stock up our food bank.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我们可以发起社交媒体捐赠活动，还可以用新闻报道来宣传，呼吁大家多捐款和食物，来充实我们的食品库。

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Government Legal Helpline for Fence Dispute
vocabulary.originalSentence: There's a standard process for these disputes. If they damaged the shared fence, they're on the hook for the full cost of the new fence.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 通常解决这类纠纷有固定流程：如果是他们造成的共有围栏损坏，就得由他们承担新栅栏的全部费用。

vocabulary.example: I understand. I know you'll check my license and driving record.

vocabulary.originalSentence: I've actually thought about that before. I've reached out to a few galleries, but their commission rates are so high and it leaves me with barely any profit.

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Social Media Strategies for Selling Art
vocabulary.originalSentence: This advice is amazing! When clients can get the full perspective of my work online, that would be more appealing. My oil paintings and sketches are just piling up at home now with nowhere to go.

vocabulary.example: You can also engage directly with potential buyers with the help of social media.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 社交媒体还能让您直接跟潜在买家互动
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Social Media Strategies for Selling Art
vocabulary.originalSentence: You can also engage directly with potential buyers with the help of social media. Also, you can post updates whenever you want and showcase new work on a regular basis.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 社交媒体还能让您直接跟潜在买家互动。而且，您可以随时发布更新和经常展示新作品。

vocabulary.example: My son is currently taking part in sports training at a hospital.

vocabulary.conversationTitle: Parent's Call for Disability Holiday Program Details
vocabulary.originalSentence: My son is currently taking part in sports training at a hospital, and just this week, I noticed a poster on the hospital notice board about your holiday program.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我儿子在一家医院参加体育训练。就在这个礼拜，我在医院的公告板上注意到了一张你们介绍这个假期项目的海报。

vocabulary.originalSentence: I'm glad that you noticed the poster. We don't promote it broadly since our support is limited to a few families annually.

vocabulary.example: Every family is assigned two bedrooms along with its own private bathroom.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 每个家庭都会配备两间卧室和独立的浴室
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Parent's Call for Disability Holiday Program Details
vocabulary.originalSentence: Every family is assigned two bedrooms along with its own private bathroom. We also supply food for shared cooking and dining, which gives you the chance to connect with new people.

vocabulary.originalSentence: I planned to go on vacation, but I just started a new job and can't take time off now.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 本来我是打算去度假的，可我刚入职一个新工作，现在请不了假。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: I planned to go on vacation. | But I just started a new job and can't take time off now.
vocabulary.chineseDelimiterVersion: 本来我是打算去度假的，可我刚入职一个新工作，现在请不了假。

vocabulary.example: Congrats on your new position!
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 恭喜您找到新工作
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Flight Change Request After New Job Start
vocabulary.originalSentence: Congrats on your new position! I'm sorry you won't make the trip—that's really unfortunate.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 恭喜您找到新工作！很遗憾您度假度不成了，太不巧了。
vocabulary.delimiterVersion: Congrats on your new position! | I'm sorry you won't make the trip—that's really unfortunate.
vocabulary.chineseDelimiterVersion: 恭喜您找到新工作 | 很遗憾您度假度不成了，太不巧了

vocabulary.example: Yes, I haven't decided what to do yet.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 是的，我也没想好该怎么办
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Flight Change Request After New Job Start
vocabulary.originalSentence: Yes, I haven't decided what to do yet. I'm thinking either to push the flight to a later date or cancel and get a refund.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 是的，我也没想好该怎么办。我正在考虑要么改期，要么退票取消预定。

vocabulary.example: Alright. When do you think you might get leave?
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 好的您估计您什么时候能休假
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Flight Change Request After New Job Start
vocabulary.originalSentence: Alright. When do you think you might get leave? Some tickets can be rescheduled or canceled, but fees may apply.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 好的。您估计您什么时候能休假？有些票可以改期或者取消，但可能会收取一些费用。

vocabulary.example: I know there will be extra fees—hopefully not too expensive.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 我知道会有些额外费用，希望不要太贵
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Flight Change Request After New Job Start
vocabulary.originalSentence: I know there will be extra fees—hopefully not too expensive. I don't have a firm leave date yet; I need to discuss it with my new employer, who said I could take time off by year's end.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 我知道会有些额外费用，希望不要太贵。我还不确定能休假的确切时间，需要跟我的新雇主商量一下。他说过年底应该可以请假。

vocabulary.example: You'll get refunded the balance after cancellation. You probably need to act soon and read the terms of your ticket carefully. Some discounted tickets aren't changeable.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 取消后差额会退还您可能得尽快操作，并仔细阅读机票的条款有些特价票不能更改
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Flight Change Request After New Job Start
vocabulary.originalSentence: It depends on your fare class, but fees are usually modest. You'll get refunded the balance after cancellation. You probably need to act soon and read the terms of your ticket carefully. Some discounted tickets aren't changeable.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 这要看您的票种，不过一般手续费不高。取消后差额会退还。您可能得尽快操作，并仔细阅读机票的条款。有些特价票不能更改。

vocabulary.example: Okay, I'll check my fare type and call you back.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 好的，我回去看看我机票的种类，再给你回电
vocabulary.conversationTitle: Flight Change Request After New Job Start
vocabulary.originalSentence: Okay, I'll check my fare type and call you back. Is that info available on your website?
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 好的，我回去看看我机票的种类，再给你回电。你们网站上能查到这些信息吗？

vocabulary.exampleChinese: 没问题，您可以在我们网站上查看所有条款和费用

vocabulary.originalSentence: Yes. You can find all terms and fees on our site. If anything's unclear, feel free to call back.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 没问题，您可以在我们网站上查看所有条款和费用。如有疑问，您尽管给我们打电话。

vocabulary.example: Hello, officer.
vocabulary.exampleChinese: 警察同志你好
vocabulary.originalSentence: Hello, officer. Someone broke into my house, and I really have no idea what to do now.
vocabulary.originalChineseSentence: 警察同志你好。我家突然有人闯进来了，我现在完全不知道该怎么办才好。
